info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:02PM EDT until July 21 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR MERCER...VENANGO...LAWRENCE...NORTHERN BUTLER...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG...CLARION AND FOREST COUNTIES... At 801 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near James City to 8 miles north of Knox to near New Wilmington, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported trees down in Mercer County. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Trees snapped and uprooted. Power outages can be expected. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Hermitage, Sharon, Butler, Oil City, Grove City, Franklin, Clarion, Sharpsville, Brookville, Marienville, Knox, Rimersburg, Ellwood City, Homeacre-Lyndora, Greenville, Sugarcreek, Farrell, Shanor-Northvue, and Meridian. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
